DOC.brief_summary: The aim study understand different fatty acid modulate postprandial lipid metabolism inflammatory response .
DOC.brief_title: Postprandial Response After Intake Meals With Different Fatty Acid Composition
DOC.criteria: 18 30 year age Healthy diagnose familial hypercholesterolemia ( FH ) ( mutation gene cod LDLreceptor ) . FH subject include : 1 . Untreated 2 . Treated low dose statin ( < 20 mg atorvastatin , < 1020 mg simvastatin < 510 mg rosuvastatin ) 3 . Treated high dose statin willing use low dose statin last 4 week prior study visit ( total 8 week period ) 4 . Treated high dose statin willing discontinue statin treatment last 4 week prior study visit ( total 8 week period ) BMI 18.5 30 kg/m2 Stabile weight last three month prior first study visit ( weight change less Â± 5 % body weight ) CRP > 10 mg/L TG > 4 mmol/L Comorbidities include diabetes type I II , coronary heart disease , haemophilia , anaemia , gastro intestinal disease , renal failure hyperthyroidism Pregnant lactate Allergic intolerant gluten egg Not willing stop use n3 fatty acid supplement last 4 week prior study visit Using medication affect lipid metabolism inflammation , except statin FH subject Hormone treatment ( except contraception thyroxin ( stabile dose last 3 month ) ) Donating blood 2 month within study period Tobacco smoke Large alcohol consumption ( > 40g daily )
